subject: Personal Finance
title: Black Monday 1987
description: A quick win: understand Black Monday 1987.

hook.text: On October 19, 1987, the Dow dropped 22.6% in one day. Still the largest single-day percentage crash ever.

buildup.text: Markets had been rising steadily. Then computerized trading programs triggered automatic sell orders.

discovery.text: Program trading created a feedback loop: selling triggered more selling, which triggered even more.

twist.text: Unlike 1929, the Fed flooded markets with cash immediately. The economy recovered within months.

climax.text: Black Monday led to circuit breakers â€” automatic trading halts when markets fall too fast.

punchline.text: Machines crashed the market. Humans fixed it.

quiz.question: What caused Black Monday's unprecedented crash?
options: Computerized program trading created a selling feedback loop
